name: transparent-minimap
description: Makes your VS Code minimap transparent, giving you more horizontal room for coding. You can also choose the color of your minimap to style it based on your theme

walkthroughs.title: Transparent Minimap Walkthrough
walkthroughs.description: Instructions on how to change your minimap transparency and minimap color. Thanks for installing Transparent Minimap!

steps.title: Your Minimap Is Now Transparent üèÜ
steps.description: Check out a code editor page and your minimap should now be transparent. If not, make sure you have your minimap enabled.

media.altText: Animation demonstrating the VSCode transparent minimap fading as its opacity decreases, showing code behind

steps.title: Change Minimap Transparency (Optional) üå´Ô∏è
steps.description:
This step will open the extension settings.
Add the transparency you wish for the minimap. Default is fully transparent.
[Adjust Minimap Transparency](command:TransparentMinimap.updateTransparency)

media.altText: Animation demonstrating the VSCode transparent minimap fading as its opacity decreases, showing code behind

steps.title: Change Minimap Color (Optional) üé®
steps.description:
This step will open the extension settings.
Change the minimap color to match your theme if you wish. Default is no color.

In order for you to theme your minimap with a custom color, the transparency level cannot be `00`. Try setting your transparency level to about `88` and play around with the values to achieve your desired color.
[Adjust Minimap Color](command:TransparentMinimap.updateColor)

media.altText: Animation of the transparent VS Code minimap cycling through changing colors from blue to green then red

steps.title: Apply Your Changes üîÅ
steps.description:
You no longer need to restart VS Code to instantly see your new minimap settings. Just run the command below:
[Refresh Minimap Transparency Settings](command:TransparentMinimap.refreshSettings)

media.altText: Animation demonstrating the VSCode transparent minimap fading as its opacity decreases, showing code behind

steps.title: Apply Changes Anytime Using Keyboard Shortcut ‚å®Ô∏è
steps.description:
You can refresh the minimap settings anywhere using the keyboard shortcut of:
``Alt+M``

media.altText: Keyboard shortcut for the Transparent Minimap extension which is Alt+M

TransparentMinimap.transparencyLevel.markdownDescription:
Transparency level of the minimap (in hexadecimal).

`00` is full transparent, `88` would be half-transparent and colored, `FF` would be no transparency and full color.

Remember to run the `Refresh Minimap Transparency Settings` command to apply the changes
TransparentMinimap.transparencyLevel.patternErrorMessage: Value must be valid 2-decimal hex number (eg. `00` or `AA`)

TransparentMinimap.minimapColor.markdownDescription:
Hex color of the minimap.

For example, `000000` is no color, `FF0000` would be fully red, `111111` would be dark grey

**NOTE - Color Only Works With A Semi-Transparent Minimap**

*In order for you to theme your minimap with a custom color, the `#TransparentMinimap.transparencyLevel#` cannot be `00`. Try setting your transparency level to about `88` and play around with the values to achieve your desired color.*

Remember to run the `Refresh Minimap Transparency Settings` command to apply the changes
TransparentMinimap.minimapColor.patternErrorMessage: Value must be valid 6-decimal color hex number (eg. `000000` or `FFAA22`)

TransparentMinimap.enableTransparentMini.markdownDescription:
Enable the extension to change the minimap to be transparent.

Uncheck this to disable the minimap transparency and color

Remember to run the `Refresh Minimap Transparency Settings` command to apply the changes.
